intro: Hieracium exclusum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. It has slender stems with alternate, narrow leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Hieracium exclusum is often found in disturbed habitats and can spread through both seeds and rhizomes.
